page.title: 12FARMING: DANE END AREA:
page.content:
There are nine farms in the D-block and we have taken{HOME FARM, DANE END as typical of the farms. {HOME FARM}is situated in a valley. It consists of 453 acres, two-thirds being arable and one-third grassland. There is a herd of Friesian cows, some of which are pedigree and these date back to the original herd which was started before the 1st World War. The farm is typical of many farms found in{HERTFORDSHIRE,}comprising various types of soil. The land is low lying gravel loam and the steep hillsides run to chalk on one side of the farm; on the South West side the land runs to London clay over the top of gravel which makes this land difficult to drain. Other farms keep sheep, pigs and chickens.
.
